question.text: Select the statement that is not correct from the following.

options.text: Plants which utilizes first, RuBP in <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math> fixations are called <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></math> plants.

Plants which utilizes first, PEP in <math><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math> fixations are called <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math> plants.
CAM plants lack structural compartmentalization of leaf, as found in  <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></math>  plants.

<math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></math>  photosynthetic pathway is more efficient than the  <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></math>  pathway.

solution.text: In C<sub>3</sub> plants, initial CO<sub>2</sub> acceptor is 5C RuBP and in C<sub>4</sub> plants initial CO<sub>2</sub> acceptor is 3C PEP. CAM plants lack structural compartmentalization of leaf as they lacks kranz antomy. C<sub>4</sub> plants are more efficient plants as Photorespiration is suppressed in C<sub>4</sub> plants.
